Module ehubicka.scheduler
Package ehubicka.Controller

Class MainScreen

java.lang.Object
ehubicka.Controller.MainScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainScreen extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class will service as the homepage of the application once a user successfully log's in. It displays the appointments table and the customers table. Customers and appointments can be added, updated or deleted. Customers can be associated with multiple appointments.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The appointments and customers tableviews are populated with existing records from the database. The current local, EST, and UTC times are also displayed on the screen for informational purposes.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - passes the resources associated with the FXML file
      resourceBundle - manages location specific resources (strings, various data-types, etc)

    • onLogoutClick

      public void onLogoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Logout the user and take them back to the login screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the logout button is selected.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onReportClick

      public void onReportClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the reports button is selected.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onUpdateTimesClick

      public void onUpdateTimesClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      For updating the times located in the bottom right corner of the mainscreen (as they don't update automatically).
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the update times button is selected.

    • currentMonthRb

      public void currentMonthRb(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The appointments table will be filtered to show only appointments scheduled for the current month.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the current month radio button is selected.

    • currentWeekRb

      public void currentWeekRb(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The appointments table will be filtered to show only appointments scheduled for the next week.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the current week radio button is selected.

    • allAppointmentsRb

      public void allAppointmentsRb(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      All appointments regardless of dates and times will be shown in the appointments table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the all appointments radio button is selected.

    • onAddAppointmentClick

      public void onAddAppointmentClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Users are taken to the add appointments screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the add appointment button is selected.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onUpdateAppointmentClick

      public void onUpdateAppointmentClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Users are taken to the update appointments screen. An error will display if a record in the appointment tableview is not selected before pressing the update button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the update appointment button is selected.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onDeleteAppointmentClick

      public void onDeleteAppointmentClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      The main screen is updated after an appointment is selected to be removed. An error will display if no record was selected to be removed before pressing the delete button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the delete button is selected.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.
      SQLException - if there is an issue with database interaction.

    • onAddCustomerClick

      public void onAddCustomerClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Users are taken to the add customers screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the add button is selected for the customer table.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onUpdateCustomerClick

      public void onUpdateCustomerClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Users are taken to the update customers screen. An error will display if a record in the customer tableview is not selected before pressing the update button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the update button is selected for the customer table.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • onDeleteCustomerClick

      public void onDeleteCustomerClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      The main screen is updated after a customer is selected to be removed. An error will display if no record was selected to be removed before pressing the delete button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the delete button is selected for the customer table.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.
      SQLException - if there is an issue with database interaction.
